layers.description: "description": "Canonical de-duplicated checklist for building the IF–THEN–THEREFORE tool",
"title": "I define the purpose and scope of my project.",
"title": "I decide whether I am building a static HTML template or an interactive tool that constructs IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains.",
"title": "I clearly state the expected outputs, such as a human-readable narrative, a machine-readable JSON, or both.",
"title": "I write a short specification describing the intended function and success criteria.",
"title": "I plan my core components before I write any code.",
"title": "I list the interface sections: an input form, a chain preview, a JSON output area, and control buttons.",
"title": "I decide how these parts will connect so that one data model powers them all.",
"title": "I keep the layout simple and logically organized.",
"title": "I use semantic HTML elements such as <header>, <main>, <section>, and <footer>.",
Got it — you’ve got a clean, de-duplicated checklist that’s basically the “spine” for building the IF–THEN–THEREFORE tool.
If we run this as a living plan, the logical next move is to start executing step 1 and filling in the result fields so the plan becomes self-documenting as you go.
Here’s a direct continuation with step 1 completed, in-place:
"description": "Canonical de-duplicated checklist for building the IF–THEN–THEREFORE tool",
"title": "I define the purpose and scope of my project.",

"result": "Purpose: Create a browser-based tool that allows users to build logical IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains visually and textually. Scope: Provide both a user-friendly interactive interface and a machine-readable JSON export. The tool will be self-contained, offline-capable, and designed for portability."
"title": "I decide whether I am building a static HTML template or an interactive tool that constructs IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains.",
"title": "I clearly state the expected outputs, such as a human-readable narrative, a machine-readable JSON, or both.",
"title": "I write a short specification describing the intended function and success criteria.",
"title": "I plan my core components before I write any code.",
"title": "I list the interface sections: an input form, a chain preview, a JSON output area, and control buttons.",
"title": "I decide how these parts will connect so that one data model powers them all.",
"title": "I keep the layout simple and logically organized.",
"title": "I use semantic HTML elements such as <header>, <main>, <section>, and <footer>.",
If you want, I can continue this pass and execute steps 2–4 next so you’ll have a complete, ready-to-build project blueprint before touching any code.
Perfect — continuing the execution pass for steps 2–4. Here’s your updated plan JSON with those steps completed:
"description": "Canonical de-duplicated checklist for building the IF–THEN–THEREFORE tool",
"title": "I define the purpose and scope of my project.",

"result": "Purpose: Create a browser-based tool that allows users to build logical IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains visually and textually. Scope: Provide both a user-friendly interactive interface and a machine-readable JSON export. The tool will be self-contained, offline-capable, and designed for portability."
"title": "I decide whether I am building a static HTML template or an interactive tool that constructs IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains.",

"result": "Choice: Interactive single-file web app (HTML+JS, no build step) with progressive enhancement. It works fully offline, and can export a static, read-only HTML summary of the current chain when needed."
"title": "I clearly state the expected outputs, such as a human-readable narrative, a machine-readable JSON, or both.",

"result": "Outputs: (1) Human-readable narrative (rendered AND copyable Markdown) in the form: IF … THEN … THEREFORE …. (2) Machine-readable JSON: {\"version\":\"1.0.0\",\"chain_id\":<uuid> ,\"nodes\":[{\"id\":\"n1\",\"type\":\"if|then|therefore\",\"text\":\"...\",\"confidence\":0-1,\"tags\":[...] }],\"edges\":[{\"from\":\"n1\",\"to\":\"n2\",\"kind\":\"supports|implies\"}],\"created\":\"ISO-8601\"}. (3) Import/Export .json file; (4) Optional static HTML snapshot."
"title": "I write a short specification describing the intended function and success criteria.",

"result": "Spec: Users can add/edit/delete IF/THEN/THEREFORE nodes; reorder via drag or arrows; set optional confidence (0–1) and tags; preview a narrative; validate presence of ≥1 IF, ≥1 THEN, and exactly 1 THEREFORE; export/import JSON; generate static HTML snapshot. Success criteria: (a) Offline, single-file app <200KB; (b) Load <1s on modern desktop; (c) Deterministic JSON export (sorted keys, stable ids); (d) Round-trip import/export without data loss; (e) Keyboard shortcuts for add/save/export; (f) No external CDN deps; (g) All actions accessible with mouse and keyboard (basic a11y)."
"title": "I plan my core components before I write any code.",
"title": "I list the interface sections: an input form, a chain preview, a JSON output area, and control buttons.",
"title": "I decide how these parts will connect so that one data model powers them all.",
"title": "I keep the layout simple and logically organized.",
"title": "I use semantic HTML elements such as <header>, <main>, <section>, and <footer>.",
Want me to knock out steps 5–7 next (components, sections, single data model) or jump straight to the base HTML scaffold?
Awesome — I’ll execute steps 5–7 now and keep everything else as-is.
"description": "Canonical de-duplicated checklist for building the IF–THEN–THEREFORE tool",
"title": "I define the purpose and scope of my project.",

"result": "Purpose: Create a browser-based tool that allows users to build logical IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains visually and textually. Scope: Provide both a user-friendly interactive interface and a machine-readable JSON export. The tool will be self-contained, offline-capable, and designed for portability."
"title": "I decide whether I am building a static HTML template or an interactive tool that constructs IF–THEN–THEREFORE chains.",

"result": "Choice: Interactive single-file web app (HTML+JS, no build step) with progressive enhancement. It works fully offline, and can export a static, read-only HTML summary of the current chain when needed."
"title": "I clearly state the expected outputs, such as a human-readable narrative, a machine-readable JSON, or both.",

"result": "Outputs: (1) Human-readable narrative (rendered AND copyable Markdown) in the form: IF … THEN … THEREFORE …. (2) Machine-readable JSON: {\"version\":\"1.0.0\",\"chain_id\":\"<uuid>\",\"nodes\":[{\"id\":\"n1\",\"type\":\"if|then|therefore\",\"text\":\"...\",\"confidence\":0-1,\"tags\":[...] }],\"edges\":[{\"from\":\"n1\",\"to\":\"n2\",\"kind\":\"supports|implies\"}],\"created\":\"ISO-8601\"}. (3) Import/Export .json file; (4) Optional static HTML snapshot."
"title": "I write a short specification describing the intended function and success criteria.",

"result": "Spec: Users can add/edit/delete IF/THEN/THEREFORE nodes; reorder via drag or arrows; set optional confidence (0–1) and tags; preview a narrative; validate presence of ≥1 IF, ≥1 THEN, and exactly 1 THEREFORE; export/import JSON; generate static HTML snapshot. Success criteria: (a) Offline, single-file app <200KB; (b) Load <1s on modern desktop; (c) Deterministic JSON export (sorted keys, stable ids); (d) Round-trip import/export without data loss; (e) Keyboard shortcuts for add/save/export; (f) No external CDN deps; (g) All actions accessible with mouse and keyboard (basic a11y)."
"title": "I plan my core components before I write any code.",

"result": "Components: (A) State Store (in-memory JS object + localStorage persistence) with {version, chain_id, nodes[], edges[], created, updated}. (B) Form Controller for creating/editing a single node (type/text/confidence/tags). (C) Chain View (ordered list + mini-graph lines) with keyboard reordering. (D) Narrative Preview renderer (Markdown-ish, deterministic). (E) JSON Panel (read-only, pretty + deterministic serializer). (F) Validator (rules: ≥1 IF, ≥1 THEN, exactly 1 THEREFORE; edges must reference existing nodes; graph must be acyclic). (G) Import/Export Controller (file open/save, static HTML snapshot). (H) Command Bar/Shortcuts (Add If/Then/Therefore, Save, Export, Validate)."
"title": "I list the interface sections: an input form, a chain preview, a JSON output area, and control buttons.",

"result": "Sections: (1) Header (title + quick actions). (2) Input Form (fields: Type[IF/THEN/THEREFORE], Text, Confidence slider, Tags). (3) Chain Preview (sortable list with up/down, delete, focus edit). (4) Narrative Preview (live). (5) JSON Output (read-only textarea with Copy + Download). (6) Footer Controls: Validate, Import, Export JSON, Export Static HTML. (7) Status Bar (last saved, validation badges)."
"title": "I decide how these parts will connect so that one data model powers them all.",

"result": "Single source of truth: `state` object. Event flow: UI → Controller mutates `state` via typed actions (addNode, updateNode, reorderNodes, removeNode, link, unlink) → `renderAll()` updates Form, Chain, Narrative, JSON, Status. Persistence: after each action, `save(state)` writes to localStorage and updates timestamps. Deterministic export: `canonicalize(state)` sorts keys, normalizes arrays, ensures stable node ids (e.g., nanoid prefix by type), then JSON.stringify with stable separators. Validation runs on each mutation; controls enable/disable based on `validation.ok`."
"title": "I keep the layout simple and logically organized.",
"title": "I use semantic HTML elements such as <header>, <main>, <section>, and <footer>.",
Want me to finish 8–10 and then generate the single-file HTML scaffold next?
Done! I finished steps 8–10 and dropped a single-file HTML scaffold in the side panel so you can run it immediately.

"result": "Layout: 2-column grid on desktop (Form + Chain on left; Narrative + JSON on right), single column on mobile; sticky header and simple footer; minimal palette; readable typography; no external dependencies; all controls labeled; keyboard shortcuts visible in footer."

"result": "Created a single-file scaffold with <header>, <main>, four <section>s (Form, Chain, Narrative, JSON), and <footer>. Each section has an inner header + content div, stable IDs, and ARIA labels. Includes minimal CSS grid and buttons, plus stub JS for state, render, validate, import/export, and shortcuts."
"title": "I use semantic HTML elements such as <header>, <main>, <section>, and <footer>.",
"result": "Confirmed: semantic regions implemented and labeled, with ARIA region names where useful. Headings are hierarchical, and interactive controls use native elements for a11y."
Working input form; add IF/THEN/THEREFORE via buttons or shortcuts (Shift+I/T/R).
Chain preview with move up/down and delete.
Live narrative preview of IF… THEN… THEREFORE….
LocalStorage persistence and basic validation badges.
Want me to wire up drag-to-reorder, add a deterministic JSON canonicalizer (sorted keys + stable IDs), or generate a static HTML snapshot template that renders a chain read-only?
yes, also create presets for html
Added drag-to-reorder (grab the ⠿ handle or use ↑/↓ buttons).
Implemented a deterministic canonicalizer (deep key-sorted JSON; stable per-type IDs like i_001, t_001, t_002, r_001).
Built a read-only HTML snapshot exporter and a Preset selector.
Wide: wider left column, slightly larger scale.
Pick a preset from the header dropdown.
Click Export HTML to save a read-only snapshot styled with that preset.
Export JSON for portable, deterministic data.
Drag the ⠿ handle to reorder items; validation updates live.
Want me to add drag-and-drop between IF / THEN / THEREFORE types, or wire up a cryptographic seal (SHA-256 of the canonical JSON) and embed it into the snapshot footer?
Drag-and-drop between types: drop any node into the IF / THEN / THEREFORE buckets above the list to retag it. If a THEREFORE already exists, I’ll block a second one and tell you why.
SHA-256 cryptographic seal of the canonical JSON. It shows in the footer (“Seal: …”) and is embedded in the exported snapshot so others can verify integrity.
Snapshot now includes a Verification section explaining how to recompute/compare the seal.
Reorder within the chain by dragging the ⠿ handle, and retag by dropping into a bucket.
The seal auto-updates whenever you change anything.
Export HTML after the seal appears to bake it into the snapshot.
a quick verifier (paste JSON; we compute SHA-256 and compare),
or inline editing of items in the chain list?
